name: fixelcorrespondence
synopsis: Obtain fixel-fixel correpondence between a subject fixel image and a template fixel mask
author: David Raffelt (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au)

description: It is assumed that the subject image has already been spatially normalised and is aligned with the template. The output fixel image will have the same fixels (and directions) of the template.

arguments.description: the input subject fixel data file. This should be a file inside the fixel directory
the fixel directory where the output file will be written.
the name of the output fixel data file. This will be placed in the output fixel directory

options.description: the max angle threshold for computing inter-subject fixel correspondence (Default: 45 degrees)
do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.
force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
display this information page and exit.
